newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH SHELL RAISES GASOLINE, DIESEL PRICES AGAIN.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH SHELL RAISES GASOLINE, DIESEL PRICES AGAIN.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell unit Shell Nederland BV said on Wednesday it would raise its retail prices for gasoline and diesel in the Netherlands effective from Friday, August 8.
Petrol prices will rise by four cents per litre and diesel prices by one cent per litre.
The move reflects changes in international product prices and the value of the dollar against the guilder, the company said.

From Friday the price of premium unleaded gasoline at Shell's self-service stations will rise to 2.28 guilders per litre. The price of super unleaded gasoline goes up to 2.33 guilders and of super with lead substitute to 2.40 guilders.
The recommended price for diesel will rise to 1.552 guilders per litre.
